title: paths.base regression between next.227 and next.228

milestone.description: stuff we need to nail down before launch

body:
### Describe the bug

I have a website with a customized `paths.base` set to `/api/docs`. My `Ã¬ndex.svelte` is a pretty basic file that has a redirect in it, redirecting to the first page of my website (which in my case is `/introduction/welcome`): 

```svelte
<script context="module" lang="ts">
  import type { LoadInput, LoadOutput } from '@sveltejs/kit'

  export function load({ stuff }: LoadInput): LoadOutput {
    return {
      status: 302,
      redirect: '/introduction/welcome',
    }
  }
</script>
```

In version `next.227`, my website could be successfully built and all the html files were built. Starting from `next.228`, the build step no longer takes the redirect from `index.svelte`  and doesn't render the rest of the website. I am almost certain it is linked to [this commit](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/pull/4761/files), but I am not entirely sure. 

**Details**
- I use `svelte-static` adapter
- I have a customized `paths.base` configuration
- `index.svelte` redirects to another page 
   -  in my case, the rest of my website is based on dynamic paths. Since the redirect is not handled, my website html files are not generated at all.





### Reproduction

I've made a minimal reproduction example: 

https://github.com/pelletier197/sveltekit-bug-reproduction

In case it may be useful, my full project is public and available [here](https://github.com/magidoc-org/magidoc/tree/main/packages/starters/carbon-multi-page).
